snippet: Ophadell Williams, who was accused of being so tired he caused a crash that killed 15 passengers, was cleared of 53 of 54 charges.
abstract: Ophadell Williams, bus driver accused of causing one of the deadliest crashes in New York City history, is found not guilty of manslaughter and negligent homicide; prosecutors said bus crash, which killed 15 of the 32 passengers and injured many more, was the result of driver fatigue.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: Ophadell Williams, who was accused of being so tired he caused a crash that killed 15 passengers, was cleared of 53 of 54 charges.

headline.seo: Ophadell Williams, Driver in Fatal Bus Crash, Found Not Guilty of Manslaughter
headline.main: Bus Driver Found Not Guilty of Manslaughter in I-95 Crash
headline.print_headline: Bus Driver Found Not Guilty of Manslaughter in Bronx Crash
